intro: Chorispermum ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian chorisperm, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as steppes and shrublands. Chorispermum ibericum is adapted to arid conditions and has a short growing season.
